revised_title: Thermochemical Analysis of Human Red Blood Cells: Enthalpy Changes in Buffer Solutions
tldr: The authors investigated the enthalpy changes that occur when human red blood cells are diluted in buffer solutions. They found that the enthalpy changes can be attributed to the increase in counterion concentration in the double layers surrounding red cells in concentrated suspensions. The results also allowed the authors to estimate the enthalpy of ionization of intracellular haemoglobin in the range of 6.0 to 8.0.
